title.narrative: Emergency response to provide life-saving access to basic WASH services and assist vulnerable children and families impacted by Hurricanes ETA and IOTA in Honduras.

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide life-saving WASH assistance to communities affected by the hurricane. This UNICEF improves access to water in shelters and surrounding homes through the installation of water storage tanks, the chlorination of strategic water points, and by trucking water. The project also improves access to WASH services in healthcare facilities, installs hand-washing facilities, distributes hygiene kits, and raises awareness about hygiene and COVID prevention. The project provides life-saving assistance to 25,000 people, including 7,750 women, 7,750 men, 9,500 children, and 1,600 people with disabilities.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Emergency response to provide life-saving access to basic WASH services and assist vulnerable children and families impacted by Hurricanes ETA and IOTA in Honduras.

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS HONDURAS RAPID RESPONSE STORM 2020

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Access to WASH in in shelters, surrounding homes and Health Care Facilities of the prioritized communities is improved
# people accessing a sufficient quantity of safe water for drinking and personal hygiene
# people reached with critical WASH supplies (including hygiene items) and services
# population under geographical influence of Health Care Facilities with improved access to WASH services
